perturbation.original_text: 2.  Term and Termination.   2.1. Term. The initial term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date, and shall continue thereafter for a period of twelve (12) months (the "Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically renew for one-month periods thereafter unless either party provides 30- days advance notice of termination, unless earlier terminated pursuant to Section 2.2 hereof. For purposes hereof, the Initial Term, together with any extension or renewal terms, shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as the "Term".
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Term and Termination. 2.1. Term. The initial term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date, and shall continue thereafter for a period of twelve (12) months (the "Initial Term"). The Initial Term may be renewed for one-month periods thereafter at the sole discretion of DSS, unless earlier terminated pursuant to Section 2.2 hereof. For purposes hereof, the Initial Term, together with any extension or renewal terms, shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as the "Term".
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the contract automatically renews unless either party terminates. The modified version gives DSS sole discretion over renewal, contradicting the automatic renewal clause and creating uncertainty for the Developer.

perturbation.original_text: 3.2. Developer hereby acknowledges DSS's claim of sole ownership of the Technology, the Improvements, and all associated goodwill. Nothing in this Agreement or in the performance thereof, or that might otherwise be implied by law, shall operate to grant Developer any right, title, or interest in or to the Technology or the Improvements. Developer hereby assigns and shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may acquire by operation of law or otherwise in the Technology or Improvements, along with the goodwill associated therewith. DSS shall have the sole right to, and in its sole discretion may, commence, prosecute or defend, and control any legal action concerning the Technology and Improvements. Developer may not contest the validity of, by act or omission jeopardize, or take any action inconsistent with, DSS's ownership rights or goodwill in the Technology or Improvements, including any attempted registration of the Technology or Improvements in Hong Kong or in any other legal jurisdiction, or any attempts to license the same to any unauthorized third Person.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.2. Developer hereby acknowledges DSS's claim of sole ownership of the Technology, the Improvements, and all associated goodwill. The parties agree that any Improvements made to the Technology may be jointly owned, depending on the level of contribution made by each party. Developer hereby assigns and shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may acquire by operation of law or otherwise in the Technology or Improvements, along with the goodwill associated therewith, unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing. DSS shall have the sole right to, and in its sole discretion may, commence, prosecute or defend, and control any legal action concerning the Technology and Improvements. Developer may not contest the validity of, by act or omission jeopardize, or take any action inconsistent with, DSS's ownership rights or goodwill in the Technology or Improvements, including any attempted registration of the Technology or Improvements in Hong Kong or in any other legal jurisdiction, or any attempts to license the same to any unauthorized third Person.
perturbation.explanation: The original text asserts DSS's sole ownership of Improvements. The modified version introduces the possibility of joint ownership, contradicting the initial claim of sole ownership and creates potential legal issues regarding intellectual property rights.
